Package controller

Class ReportMenuController

  • java.lang.Object
    • controller.ReportMenuController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.fxml.Initializable
    public class ReportMenuController
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
    This class adds and controls all the functionality of the Report Menu.

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void addAppointmentMonthsTotals()
      Generates a list of Months in which Appointments are scheduled, any duplicates are ignored.
      void addAppointmentsByContact()
      The first step for this tab to work is to ake the selection Combobox and label visible.
      void addAppointmentTypesTotals()
      Gathers the different Types of Appointments, ignores any duplicate types.
      void addContactAppointmentData()
      Uses the selected name from the Combobox to find all the matching Appointments connected to that Customer.
      void addCustomersByDivision()
      Report 3 - Customer by Division This method matches Division ID with Customer_Division ID in order to populate the table and display which Customer is located in which Division.
      void addTypeMonthTotalAppointments()
      Combines above functions in order for the tables in this first tab get populated with the pertinent information.
      void goToAppointmentRB​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)  
      void goToCustomerRB​(javafx.event.ActionEvent event)  
      void initialize​(java.net.URL url, java.util.ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
      This method initializes the MainController and populates the all table views required for the different reports.

      • addAppointmentTypesTotals

        public void addAppointmentTypesTotals()
                               throws java.sql.SQLException
        Gathers the different Types of Appointments, ignores any duplicate types. Checks the frequency in which each Type appears, creates instance of the class and sets the list for tableview
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if exception has occurred

      • addAppointmentMonthsTotals

        public void addAppointmentMonthsTotals()
                                throws java.sql.SQLException
        Generates a list of Months in which Appointments are scheduled, any duplicates are ignored. Calculates the occurrence of each month, creates an instance of class and sets the list for tableview
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if some form of exception is triggered

      • addTypeMonthTotalAppointments

        public void addTypeMonthTotalAppointments()
                                   throws java.sql.SQLException
        Combines above functions in order for the tables in this first tab get populated with the pertinent information.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if some form of exception is triggered

      • addAppointmentsByContact

        public void addAppointmentsByContact()
                              throws java.sql.SQLException
        The first step for this tab to work is to ake the selection Combobox and label visible. This populates the Contact Names into the Combobox.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if exception has occurred

      • addContactAppointmentData

        public void addContactAppointmentData()
                               throws java.sql.SQLException
        Uses the selected name from the Combobox to find all the matching Appointments connected to that Customer.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if exception has occurred

      • addCustomersByDivision

        public void addCustomersByDivision()
                            throws java.sql.SQLException
        Report 3 - Customer by Division This method matches Division ID with Customer_Division ID in order to populate the table and display which Customer is located in which Division. This type of report is important so company management can view which Division contains the most valuable Customers, and in which Division the company should invest more in order to gain more customers.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - if exception has occurred

      • initialize

        public void initialize​(java.net.URL url,
                       java.util.ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
        This method initializes the MainController and populates the all table views required for the different reports.
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable
        Parameters:
        url - The url is used to find the relative paths for the root object.
        resourceBundle - The resource bundle is used to localize the root object.
